result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary P Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant eligible for early discharge after 3 years if complies with all conditions of probation and upon Agent's application to the Court.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not terminate mental health or drug treatment without providers or Agent's permission.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 72 hours of an new or changing prescriptions.
Defendant shall notify Agent within 72 hours of any medical appointment.

timeConds.notes:
5 months stayed - to be used at Agent's discretion.
Agent and Jail to coordinate start date.
